result.execSummary:
The defendant Amari Dontae Fearen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Pay a fine of $250 including all costs. Any cash bail is to apply. Court set restitution to at $0.00.
*With credit for 2 days time served. This is a Time Served Disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amari Dontae Fearen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered fine INCLUDING ALL COSTS, etc.  $250.00 cash bail on deposit to apply.

Defendant Amari Dontae Fearen in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1 as amended:
Court sentenced the defendant to 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  This is a time served disposition.
Court orders Defendant to pay a fine of $250.00 including costs.  Any cash bail is to apply.  Court set restitution at $0.00.



Case will need to be recalled in order a due date to be scheduled for the fine.

Defendant Amari Dontae Fearen in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to DISORDERLY CONDUCT, domestic abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)947.01(1) , a Class A misdemeanor.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing adjourned for victim notification.  Sentencing adjourned to 11-9-2015 at 1:15pm  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Amari Dontae Fearen in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Witness is present in court, but not the victim.  Defense moves to adjourn jury trial, based on the receipt of late discovery.  Court heard and grants defense motion to adjourn jury trial.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-12-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse..All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Diamond H., or her residence or witness, Syronia C., no weapons in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Amari Dontae Fearen in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
There is a 911 cd still outstanding, per the State and will be forwarded to defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-24-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Diamond H., or her residence or Syronia C., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Amari Dontae Fearen in court with attorney Terese Dick.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-19-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

15RM003118  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-25-2015
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DIAMOND H. OR HER RESIDENCE AND WITNESS, SYRONIA C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Amari Dontae Fearen in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Amari Dontae Fearen in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
